title: Man Confirmed Dead After Gold Mine Incident In Queensland | 10 News
description: A man has died following an incident at a Gold Mine in Queensland.  This follows another incident which occurred at the Mammoth underground operation at the Curragh mine near Blackwater. title: Deadly Swiss Ski Resort Bar Fire Leaves Parents Searching For Missing Children | 10 News
description: As authorities gain a clearer picture of what sparked the blaze at a Swiss ski resort bar just hours into the New Year, they warn it will take much longer to identify the dozens of young people killed.  That has left parents desperately trying to find out whether their missing children are among the injured or the dead. title: Trump Issues Warning To Iran As Cost-Of-Living Protests Turn Deadly | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has issued a warning to Iran as cost-of-living protests in the country turn deadly. title: Explosions Reported In Venezuelan Capital Caracas Amid Rising Tensions With United States | 10 News
description: #BREAKING: Explosions have been reported in Venezuela.  Videos show several fiery explosions in the nation’s capital, Caracas.  The extent of any injuries is unclear at this stage, with residents reporting low-flying aircraft in the area.  The blasts come amid escalating tensions between the country and the United States.

title: President Trump Announces U.S. Control of Venezuela After Maduro Captured Overnight | 10 News
description: The United States has captured long-serving Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro during an overnight operation on Saturday.  U.S. President Donald Trump said Maduro and his wife were “captured and flown out of the country” following what he described as a “large-scale strike” by U.S. forces.  Trump added that the United States would temporarily place Venezuela under American control, deploying U.S. forces “if necessary.”  Speaking to the media, Trump said, “So, I’d like to do it quickly, but it takes a period of time. You know, we’re rebuilding… we have to rebuild their whole infrastructure. The infrastructure is rotted. It’s actually very dangerous.”  Maduro and his wife arrived in New York on Saturday to face federal charges related to drug trafficking and alleged cooperation with gangs designated as terrorist organizations. Maduro has denied the accusations.  Maduro’s removal after more than 12 years in power has raised concerns about a potential power vacuum in Venezuela. title: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro Arrives On U.S. Soil Following Capture | 10 News
description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has arrived on U.S. soil overnight following the capture of him and his wife by U.S. forces.  Video footage shows the plane landing at Stewart Air National Guard Base in New York, surrounded by hundreds of U.S. personnel and FBI agents.  Maduro faces multiple criminal charges in the United States, including narco-terrorism conspiracy, stemming from allegations that he and his administration were involved in a vast network trafficking cocaine into the country. He is expected to appear in Manhattan federal court on Monday.  Following his capture, Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodríguez has reportedly been sworn in as the country’s new president, backed by President Trump and the United States. title: Trump Signals Possible Deployment of US Ground Forces in Venezuela Following Maduro Arrest | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has said he is not afraid to “put boots on the ground” following the seizure of Venezuela into US control.  The comment comes after the overnight arrest of President Nicolás Maduro, with the U.S. prepared to take further military action if necessary.  Speaking to the media, Trump said, “We’re not afraid of boots on the ground if we have to. We had boots on the ground last night at a very high level, actually.”  He also confirmed that Secretary Marco Rubio has been in contact with Venezuela’s acting vice president and that the United States would oversee Venezuela “with a group,” that Rubio will manage. title: U.S. Launches Overnight Military Strike On Venezuela, Capturing President Nicolás Maduro | 10 News
description: An extraordinary and potentially explosive moment in global politics is unfolding right now.  The United States has launched a secret assault on Venezuela, capturing its president in a lightning raid just after 2am local time.  Elite Delta Force soldiers breached the Presidential Palace in Caracas, arresting Nicolás Maduro in what the White House is calling a decisive end to his rule. title: 29-Year-Old Man Found In Boot Of Car After Alleged Kidnapping In Western Sydney | 10 News
description: A man has been found alive after being kidnapped, stabbed, and stuffed into the boot of a car in western Sydney.  He was discovered by chance when emergency crews were called to assist with another issue at a carpark next to a unit complex. title: Swiss Ski Bar Managers Under Criminal Investigation Over Deadly Fire | 10 News
description: Swiss prosecutors have launched a criminal investigation into the managers of a bar where a fire killed at least 40 people.  The French couple involved face charges of manslaughter by negligence, bodily harm by negligence, and arson by negligence. title: Sydney Storm Halts England’s Charge in Ashes Test At SCG | 10 News
description: Rain halted England’s progress as they looked to inflict more damage on Australia at the SCG today.  Joe Root and Harry Brook both scored half-centuries, helping England recover from a top-order collapse.  England were 3 for 211 before the weather intervened.
